closed_reason: Read cmd/ticker/main.go and identified 4 subcommands: run (execute epics with AI agent), resume (continue from checkpoint), checkpoints (list saved checkpoints), and upgrade (update to latest version). The root command is ticker itself.
description: Read cmd/ticker/main.go and list all subcommands defined.

run.output:
I'll start by reading the `cmd/ticker/main.go` file to identify all subcommands defined.

Based on reading `cmd/ticker/main.go`, I can identify all the subcommands defined. The CLI uses Cobra and has the following commands:

**Root command:** `ticker` - Autonomous AI agent loop runner

**Subcommands:**
1. **`run`** - Run one or more epics with the AI agent
   - Usage: `ticker run <epic-id> [epic-id...]`
   - Flags: `--max-iterations/-n`, `--max-cost`, `--checkpoint-interval`, `--max-task-retries`, `--auto`, `--headless`, `--jsonl`, `--skip-verify`, `--verify-only`, `--worktree`, `--parallel`

2. **`resume`** - Resume from a checkpoint
   - Usage: `ticker resume <checkpoint-id>`
   - Requires exactly 1 argument

3. **`checkpoints`** - List available checkpoints
   - Usage: `ticker checkpoints [epic-id]`
   - Takes optional epic-id to filter by

4. **`upgrade`** - Upgrade ticker to the latest version
   - Usage: `ticker upgrade`

Now I'll close the task and add an epic note.

Task completed. The ticker CLI defines 4 subcommands in `cmd/ticker/main.go`:

1. **`run`** - Run one or more epics with the AI agent (lines 52-74)
2. **`resume`** - Resume from a checkpoint (lines 76-84)
3. **`checkpoints`** - List available checkpoints (lines 86-95)
4. **`upgrade`** - Upgrade ticker to the latest version (lines 97-128)

All commands are added to the root command in the `init()` function (lines 144-147).

title: List CLI commands
